Published by Clarkson Potter/Publishers, an imprint of Penguin Random House LLC.EmailPinterestPrintEmailPinterestPrintMaking ribs at home can be sooooo intimidating. Pretty much every rib recipe involves hours of smoking or slow-baking and, in the end, I’m saying, ‘I could have just ordered these from Uncle Andre’s.’ (That’s one of our favorite L.A. BBQ spots. #nospon #notpaidforthat.) Anyway, enter Pepper Thai with the perfect solution: Fry the ribs! These Thai fried ribs are so easy! Just a few ingredients and a few minutes and you have hot, juicy ribs with a soy-garlic-rubbed Thai twist. Fry some ribs for your next football party. Your friends will leave happy even if the other team scores all the home runs. Reprinted from Cravings: Hungry for More. Copyright © 2018 by Chrissy Teigen. Published by Clarkson Potter/Publishers, an imprint of Penguin Random House LLC.Ingredients2–4 servings1rack baby back pork ribs (12–14 ribs), separated into individual ribs2Tbsp. soy sauce7garlic cloves, finely chopped1tsp. freshly ground black pepperVegetable oil (for frying; about 2 qt.)PreparationStep 1Place ribs in a large bowl. Add soy sauce, garlic, and pepper and toss to coat. Let stand at room temperature.Step 2Heat oil in a large heavy pot over medium-high until a deep-fry thermometer registers 370°. (Or test oil by throwing in a little piece of bread or some breadcrumbs; if they sizzle immediately but aren’t burning, you’re ready.) Working in batches, fry ribs until just cooked and well browned, 3–4 minutes. Return oil to 370° between batches and try to skim out any stray bits of garlic so they don’t burn in the oil and make it taste like burnt garlic.Step 3Transfer ribs to a platter and serve plain or with your favorite hot sauce alongside.How would you rate Chrissy Teigen’s Thai Soy-Garlic Fried Ribs?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (2)Back to TopTriangle@siraphyn you can use www.bonappetit.com/recipe/spicy-thai-dipping-sauce/
It’s a pretty standard Thai hot sauce, you can also substitute the Thai chili’s for a Product: 
Momoya rayu chili oil with fried garlic 
Which is really tasty and pretty spicy, that will give you the best “sauce” to match that picture ChicChefAmandaAtlanta, GA 8/28/2020This looks amazing, however those measurements don't equal the amount of "sauce" in that bowl.
